file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 73-32-01-04 - FUEL TEMPERATURE SENSOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FUEL TEMPERATURE SENSOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the Fuel Temperature Sensor. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY FUEL TEMPERATURE SENSOR - RE- ALL 73-32-01-000-801-A MOVAL FUEL TEMPERATURE SENSOR - INSTAL- ALL 73-32-01-400-801-A LATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 73-32-01 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 73-32-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. FUEL TEMPERATURE SENSOR - REMOVAL A. General (1) To do the removal procedure, obey the instructions contained in Rolls-Royce MM CSP 34022. (2) This procedure is applicable to the left and right engines. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 71-12-01-000-801-A/400 ENGINE LOWER COWLING - OPENING C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 413 Lower Cowling LH Engine 423 Lower Cowling RH Engine D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the engine 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Engine I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN ( AMM MPP 71-00-00/200) TO PREVENT INJURY TO THE PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO THE MATERIAL. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 73-32-01 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open these circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them: • START 1/2. (2) Put the workstand in the work area. (3) Open the lower cowling ( AMM TASK 71-12-01-000-801-A/400) to get access to the engine. J. Removal SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the Fuel Temperature Sensor. Refer to the last revision of Rolls-Royce MM CSP 34022. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 73-32-01 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 73-32-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. FUEL TEMPERATURE SENSOR - INSTALLATION A. General (1) To do the installation procedure, obey the instructions contained in Rolls-Royce MM CSP 34022. (2) This procedure is applicable to the left and right engines. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 71-12-01-400-801-A/400 ENGINE LOWER COWLING - CLOSING C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 413 Lower Cowling LH Engine 423 Lower Cowling RH Engine D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the engine 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Engine I. Installation SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN ( AMM MPP 71-00-00/200) TO PREVENT INJURY TO THE PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO THE MATERIAL. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 73-32-01 Page 4 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (1) Install the fuel temperature sensor. Refer to the last revision of Rolls-Royce MM CSP 34022. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Refer to the Rolls-Royce MM CSP 34022 to do the related check procedures after an engine LRU maintenance procedure, as applicable. (2) On the circuit breaker panel, close these circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT- CLOSE tag from them: • START 1/2. (3) Close the lower cowling ( AMM TASK 71-12-01-400-801-A/400). (4) Remove the workstand from the work area. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 73-32-01 Page 5 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
